page.title: 01General Description
page.content: The land in our block is mostly wetland.It is part of the Somerset Levels and lies mainly between the rivers{Parrett}and{Tone.}The river {Tone}joins the river{Parrett}near the village of{Burrowbridge}which is in the South East corner of our block.Apart from this village and the outskirts of the villages of Moorland and Lyng there are very few dwellings. The land is divided into small rectangular fields by drainage ditches or rhynes.There are several cattle droves by which the farmers gain access to their fields.The main road A361 from{Taunton}passes through Burrowbridge.The road from Burrowbridge to Moorland is a narrow country road with passing places at intervals to enable cars to pass.The only high ground is Burrow Mump.
